comment._content: Do we know what street that's on? I'd love to see if there are any remaining remnants from this time. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - I saw this Spectacular Photo in: Chicagoland Architecture, Engineering and Art! comment.author: 67030224@N06
comment._content:
Ahhh... okay... 15th and Wabash (from the wiki link above).

South of Roosevelt, huh? hmmm... I'll have to wander around down there and see what I can find.  Google says there's just a park there now called, "Coliseum Park."

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Ematu: According to the Chicago Park District website, the park was named in honor of the coliseum that had existed on a part of the site at East 14th and South Wabash Avenues.  If you get over there, let us know if you find any remnants from the time.
